items.sentence: I thought you knew that Tom wasn\'t going to do that.
Tom seems to be unwilling to tell Mary what happened.
Tom spent the night in the small cabin near the lake.
I think I\'ll be able to solve the problem by myself.
Tom said he\'d rather not spend much time doing that.
Tom said that he doesn\'t really want that to happen.
Tom thinks he can do the job better than anyone else.
Tom thinks that Mary is being unnecessarily cautious.
Tom lost both of his parents when he was quite young.
It wasn\'t very smart of you to throw that note away.
We\'ve decided to stay in Boston for a few more days.
Tom wasn\'t the only one who didn\'t need to do that.
Tom was getting sleepy since it was past his bedtime.
Tom was only thinking about how to save his own skin.
Tom was sentenced to thirteen years for manslaughter.
We were completely exhausted from the five-hour trip.
You\'re going to have to live with what you\'ve done.
I have two cats. One is black and the other is white.
Has Tom told Mary that he can\'t speak French at all?
I didn\'t think about the situation carefully enough.
I told Tom I didn\'t want to hear about his problems.
I told Tom that I didn\'t want to ever see him again.
Tom and Mary have dinner together almost every night.
Tom and Mary have finally moved into their new house.
Where to go and what to see were my primary concerns.
Why are Tom and I always the ones who have to suffer?
Why did you think you could do this without any help?
If you ever feel like doing that, go ahead and do it.
Tom has a small antique shop right next to his house.
You should make sure that Tom doesn\'t do that today.
I believe we have a staff meeting scheduled for 2:30.
I asked Tom not to tell my parents what had happened.
What\'s your favorite way to stay cool in the summer?
It isn\'t much fun just sitting here waiting for Tom.
Tom committed suicide by jumping in front of a train.
Tom didn\'t believe Mary when she said she loved him.
Tom didn\'t buy the dress Mary wanted him to buy her.
Tom didn\'t deny that he was the one who killed Mary.
Tom didn\'t do any of the work he was supposed to do.
Tom and Mary spend as much time together as they can.
Tom and Mary were able to figure it out on their own.
Tom and his friends played hockey on the frozen pond.

I can\'t believe I let you talk me into volunteering.
Only the fools and the dead never change their minds.
Tell Tom that I\'m going to do that as soon as I can.

I think you should do everything Tom tells you to do.
